resources.splines

Class SimpleSpline

  • java.lang.Object
    • resources.splines.SimpleSpline
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Renderable, Resource, Spline
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CubicSpline

    public class SimpleSpline
extends java.lang.Object
implements Spline
    Represents a simple spline. It stores the control points and data you need to render it.

      • computeSplineData

        @NotNull
protected float[] computeSplineData()
        Returns the splie's data based on the control points and the type of the spline. Also computes the AABB and the bounding sphere.
        Returns:
        the spline's data

      • getValue

        @Nullable
protected org.joml.Vector3f getValue(int startIndex,
                                                float t)
        Returns the point on the spline between the startIndexth and startIndex+1th controlpoints, specified by the argument t. This method returns to null if the spline doesn't contain any points. The startIndex can't be lower than 0 and can't be higher than the control point's number -1 (except if it's a loop spline).
        Parameters:
        startIndex - start control point's index
        t - "time"
        Returns:
        the specified point of the spline
        See Also:
        getNumberOfControlPoints()

      • refreshLength

        protected void refreshLength()
        If the stored length isn't valid, this method refreshes it.

      • isDynamic

        public boolean isDynamic()
        Determines whether the spline's data is dynamic.
        Returns:
        true if the spline's data is dynamic, false otherwise

      • setDynamic

        public void setDynamic(boolean dynamic)
        Sets whether or not the spline is dynamic. It is advised to set the spline to dynamic if you want to change the spline's data frequently.
        Parameters:
        dynamic - true if the spline's data should be dynamic, false otherwise

      • getRequiredControlPoints

        public int getRequiredControlPoints()
        Returns the required number of control points. If the spline contains less control points, you can't render the spline.
        Returns:
        the required number of control points to render the spline

      • getRadius

        public float getRadius()
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        Returns the distance between the origin and the furthest vertex. This value is not depends on a GameObject's scale (object space), so if you scale the mesh, this method gives you wrong value. If you want to get the scaled value of the furthest vertex distance (what is depends on the GameObject's scale), use the MeshComponent's or SplineComponent's getScaledFurthestVertexDistance() method.
        Specified by:
        getRadius in interface Renderable
        Returns:
        furthest vertex distance
        See Also:
        MeshComponent#getRealFurthestVertexDistance(), SplineComponent#getRealFurthestVertexDistance()
